title.native: ガールズ&パンツァー 劇場版

description:
When the Ministry of Education goes back on its promise to keep Ooarai Girls Academy open, the task of saving the five-mile-long Academy Ship from the wreckers falls to Miho and her barely-seasoned tankery team. However, things go off track almost immediately. While the Oorai tank crew may have won the high school tournament, they’re now facing a larger and more experienced university team, and if they fail, their armored vehicles will be forfeit! Will they be swapping their tanks for the memories? It’s possible, but winning a tank battle is all about tactics and teamwork, and the fledgling Ooarai students have more friends and allies than anyone suspects.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamibun)

A freelance writer who specialises in military and historical research. He graduated from Hokkaido University's Department of Literature and Philosophy.

His most important work was the multimedia project Strike Witches, for which he provided military and world research aide as well as penned scripts for the anime series and wrote lyrics for several related songs. His other works include short novel stories for various magazines, like MC Axis, two currently serialised manga series with Tsuki no Umi no Rua (Young King Ours) and Sailor Fuku to Juusensha (Champion Red Ichigo) and several doujin works. He did also write scripts and was SF aide for the Gonzo anime series Last Exile, Witchblade, GunXSword and Solty Rei.

He is member of the doujin circle Firstspear.

(Source: Anidb)
The founder and representative director of Studio Tulip.

Recently known for his work in Strike Witches doujinshi (Witches in Africa).    Nogami started his professional mangaka career with Koutetsu no Shoujo-tachi (a.k.a Panzerfraulein) published by Kadokawa Shoten, which due to various circumstances, was cancelled by the publisher after Book 4.    Now, his activities include “Sailor Fuku to Jyuusensha”, a comic about tank-riding high school girls published by Akita Shoten; “Tsuki no Umi no Rua”, a comic inspired by Kaguya-hime tales in a World War II setting, from Shonen Gahosha; and the comic for “Moeyo Sensha Gakkou!!”, a semi-educational book about tanks from Ikaros Publishing.    As visible in his portfolio, he seems to be inclined towards military-themed stories.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takeshi_nogami)
Well known for his character designs on the [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131/) series.
Well known for his character designs on the [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131/) series.
**Ogisu Hirotsugu (小岐須泰世)** is a Japanese producer.

Kawashiro Kazumi is the president & CEO of Bandai Visual. He graduated from Sophia University - a private university in Japan famous for its international climate. In April of 1982, a month after graduation, he started working at Canyon Records. In July of 1989 he joined Bandai and in April of 1994 he was transferred to Bandai Visual of which he became the president of in May of 2003. In 2010, he was succeeded by Ooshita Satoshi, although Kawashiro remained in the company as the vice-president. In April 2012, he was again appointed the president of Bandai Visual.

(Source: AniDB)

**Spouse:** [Masumi Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/103635/Masumi-Itou) (alternatively known as Hikaru Nanase)

**Yoshiyuki Itou** is a Japanese producer, music producer and animation planner. He works as a music producer for the company Lantis.
